comments.html: There is also the ICMP redirect. It should never be a comment on a routing article, but my experience shows otherwise... I once saw a network that had thousands of routes where there was a particular segment that relied on ICMP redirects rather than advertising routes across the 2 routers... meaning they were generating redirects for each IP destination crossing. They, for some reason, had huge performance issues...
